Title: Junior Python AI Developer
Description:
Per tutte le posizioni come 'Junior AI Developer' offriamo una RAL iniziale di €25.000. Avrai la possibilità di formarti ogni giorno grazie al training on the job, di lavorare sia in ufficio che in full remote per tutto il tempo che vorrai, di usufruire di ferie illimitate.




Cerchiamo sia profili senza esperienza, sia profili con al massimo 3 anni di esperienza pregressa.




All'interno del team, ti potrai occupare di uno o più di queste attività:

In base al tuo interesse e all'esigenza dell'azienda, verrai formato e coinvolto dai colleghi senior in tecnologie o linguaggi diversi: AI (Intelligenza Artificiale), Cybersecurity, App & Web Development, Machine Learning, Data Scientist, Data Engineer, JavaScript, Web Development, Flutter, Salesforce, NextJS, Typescript e Kubernetes.




COSA TI OFFRIAMO

Ti garantiamo sempre le condizioni di benessere fisico e mentale per lavorare al meglio. Questo si traduce in:

Remote working e flessibilità. Avrai l’opportunità di lavorare in full remote per tutto il tempo che desideri.
Ferie illimitate. La politica non è lavorare tanto, ma lavorare bene: per questo potrai prenderti tutte le ferie di cui hai bisogno per raggiungere i tuoi obiettivi e quelli dell’azienda.
Ambiente di lavoro dinamico. Gli uffici restano comunque sempre aperti. Abbiamo un ambiente di lavoro informale che favorisce momenti di condivisione, sempre nel rispetto delle attività individuali.
Team building & fun. Organizziamo aperitivi, giochi e momenti di svago che, sono parte integrante sia fuori che dentro l’ufficio.
Welfare aziendale.
Training. Sarai sempre affiancato da un tutor nel tuo percorso formativo: avrai un punto di riferimento sia per gli aspetti tecnici che per quelli di team. Ti assicuriamo una crescita professionale costante che si concretizzerà con l’aumento progressivo delle tue responsabilità. Potrai partecipare a eventi di settore e corsi di formazione, oltre ad avere una training continuo sulle migliori piattaforme di e-learning.
Social impact. Il tuo contribuito supporterà migliaia di persone a trovare il lavoro a cui aspirano: avrai la possibilità di confrontarti con la nostra community e scoprire l’impatto sociale e la rivoluzione che stiamo creando.




CHI SIAMO

Siamo una squadra che vuole semplificare la ricerca del lavoro a diplomati, studenti universitari, neolaureati e profili junior, per permettergli di sognare a occhi aperti un futuro proprio come se l’erano immaginato.




Guidati da un approccio tech e data, fortemente creativo, ambizioso e ottimistico ma pur sempre realistico, supportiamo le aziende in cerca di giovani pronti a mettersi in gioco. Le aiutiamo a trovare le persone giuste dai CV più inaspettati.




Le aziende si fidano di noi, scegliendoci ogni giorno per diventare più attraenti e crescere in modo esponenziale.




CONTRATTO E RETRIBUZIONE

È prevista, ogni sei mesi, una review dello stipendio e la tua retribuzione crescerà rapidamente man mano che accumulerai esperienza e la tradurrai in un impatto sempre maggiore per l’azienda.




PROCESSO DI SELEZIONE

Screening della domanda di partecipazione alla selezione dei candidati.
Valutazione del percorso formativo iniziale che ci darà modo di valutare le reali capacità dei candidati.
Colloquio telefonico con HR Manager.
Colloquio video con l'HR Manager e futuro responsabile.




Requisiti indispensabili per la partecipazione alla fase formativa iniziale

Stato di disoccupazione.
Residenza in regione Lombardia.




Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91 e, a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.

Si invitano gli interessati, prima di inviare le candidature, a consultare l’informativa sulla privacy (Regolamento UE 679/2016 - D. Lgs. 196/2003).

Show more
HTML:
Per tutte le posizioni come 'Junior AI Developer' offriamo una RAL iniziale di €25.000. Avrai la possibilità di formarti ogni giorno grazie al training on the job, di lavorare sia in ufficio che in full remote per tutto il tempo che vorrai, di usufruire di ferie illimitate.


Cerchiamo sia profili senza esperienza, sia profili con al massimo 3 anni di esperienza pregressa.


All'interno del team, ti potrai occupare di uno o più di queste attività:

In base al tuo interesse e all'esigenza dell'azienda, verrai formato e coinvolto dai colleghi senior in tecnologie o linguaggi diversi: AI (Intelligenza Artificiale), Cybersecurity, App & Web Development, Machine Learning, Data Scientist, Data Engineer, JavaScript, Web Development, Flutter, Salesforce, NextJS, Typescript e Kubernetes.


COSA TI OFFRIAMO

Ti garantiamo sempre le condizioni di benessere fisico e mentale per lavorare al meglio. Questo si traduce in:

  • Remote working e flessibilità. Avrai l’opportunità di lavorare in full remote per tutto il tempo che desideri.
  • Ferie illimitate. La politica non è lavorare tanto, ma lavorare bene: per questo potrai prenderti tutte le ferie di cui hai bisogno per raggiungere i tuoi obiettivi e quelli dell’azienda.
  • Ambiente di lavoro dinamico. Gli uffici restano comunque sempre aperti. Abbiamo un ambiente di lavoro informale che favorisce momenti di condivisione, sempre nel rispetto delle attività individuali.
  • Team building & fun. Organizziamo aperitivi, giochi e momenti di svago che, sono parte integrante sia fuori che dentro l’ufficio.
  • Welfare aziendale.
  • Training. Sarai sempre affiancato da un tutor nel tuo percorso formativo: avrai un punto di riferimento sia per gli aspetti tecnici che per quelli di team. Ti assicuriamo una crescita professionale costante che si concretizzerà con l’aumento progressivo delle tue responsabilità. Potrai partecipare a eventi di settore e corsi di formazione, oltre ad avere una training continuo sulle migliori piattaforme di e-learning.
  • Social impact. Il tuo contribuito supporterà migliaia di persone a trovare il lavoro a cui aspirano: avrai la possibilità di confrontarti con la nostra community e scoprire l’impatto sociale e la rivoluzione che stiamo creando.


CHI SIAMO

Siamo una squadra che vuole semplificare la ricerca del lavoro a diplomati, studenti universitari, neolaureati e profili junior, per permettergli di sognare a occhi aperti un futuro proprio come se l’erano immaginato.


Guidati da un approccio tech e data, fortemente creativo, ambizioso e ottimistico ma pur sempre realistico, supportiamo le aziende in cerca di giovani pronti a mettersi in gioco. Le aiutiamo a trovare le persone giuste dai CV più inaspettati.


Le aziende si fidano di noi, scegliendoci ogni giorno per diventare più attraenti e crescere in modo esponenziale.


CONTRATTO E RETRIBUZIONE

È prevista, ogni sei mesi, una review dello stipendio e la tua retribuzione crescerà rapidamente man mano che accumulerai esperienza e la tradurrai in un impatto sempre maggiore per l’azienda.


PROCESSO DI SELEZIONE

  1. Screening della domanda di partecipazione alla selezione dei candidati.
  2. Valutazione del percorso formativo iniziale che ci darà modo di valutare le reali capacità dei candidati.
  3. Colloquio telefonico con HR Manager.
  4. Colloquio video con l'HR Manager e futuro responsabile.


Requisiti indispensabili per la partecipazione alla fase formativa iniziale

  • Stato di disoccupazione.
  • Residenza in regione Lombardia.


Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91 e, a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.

Si invitano gli interessati, prima di inviare le candidature, a consultare l’informativa sulla privacy (Regolamento UE 679/2016 - D. Lgs. 196/2003).

Title: Customer Insight Data Scientist
HTML:
Country: Italy

City: Milano, piazza Luigi Einaudi, 4

Contract Type: Regular

Department: Marketing & Communications

Experience Required: 2 Years

Mode: Hybrid


Versace is one of the most recognizable names in the world. The luxury House immediately became a leader in fashion and culture following its founding in 1978 by Gianni Versace, and it continues to lead with purpose under the creative vision of Donatella Versace.



Your Opportunity:


As Customer Insights Data Scientist , you will perform various functions, including analysing customer data to provide support for sales and marketing efforts, providing useful insight on the effectiveness of marketing campaigns; and helping to initiate and implement CRM initiatives that will boost brand and customer loyalty and drive CLV.


Your Contribution:


  • Deliver customer insights and make recommendations by performing data analyses and post activity evaluations;
  • Develop and own customer models to predict customer response rate, customer frequency rate, customer life-time value (LTV), etc;
  • Responsible for identifying different customer profiles, and carrying out the optimization of CRM/marketing activities by defining market sectors and customer selection based on customer profiling and segmentation;
  • Responsible for initiating and organizing mini surveys to gather deeper customer insights on CRM related topics;
  • Undertake spontaneous initiation of any analysis that can generate customer insight or operational projects to add value to the customer relationship;
  • Conduct assessment of CRM programs, club communications, and promotional activities according to their efficiency and profitability;
  • Serve as a custodian of customer database, and responsible for the maintenance and management of customer data to ensure data integrity in partnership with CRM Project Manager;
  • Provide support for local, regional and international CRM projects as applicable in the organization
  • Provide timely and accurate weekly/ monthly reporting of KPI;
  • Measure, analyse, and report performance metrics pertaining to the organizations’ loyalty campaigns;
  • Provide support for the development of predictive models, customer segmentation studies, and reports;
  • Responsible for optimizing and measuring CRM paid social media campaigns .


Your Skills:


  • 2+ years of relevant experience in marketing research & analysis; experience in telecom, high-tech or software are a plus;
  • 2 years of professional experience in VIC Relations, Marketing, and/or Retail;
  • Bachelor’s Degree in related fields of study;
  • Data Modelling / Visualization tools knowledge ( Python , SQL, Power BI, Tableau);
  • Experience in running multiple complex projects, numerous internal teams and a myriad of external vendors;
  • Strong analytical and interpretive skills with the ability to distill copious amounts of data (qualitative, quantitative, secondary etc.) into an insightful story with actionable recommendations;
  • Passionate about moving from data and insight to action and impact with a sense of urgency;
  • Executive presence when presenting to key partners across the organization;
  • Highly collaborative and demonstrated ability to work closely across both marketing and cross-functional teams;
  • Entrepreneurial spirit with the ability to work cross-functionally and navigate quickly changing environments;
  • Strong attention to detail and analytical skills;
  • Marketing and Events experience;
  • Proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint.



Diversity and inclusion are integral to Versace's DNA. We promote an inclusive environment where employees and customers from diverse backgrounds are welcomed, valued, and celebrated. We take pride in our commitment to diversity, equality, and inclusion, and will continue to uphold these principles wherever we do business. Our doors are open to all.

WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER M/D/F

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Link copied!

Would you like to get involved and join a dynamic company?

You are in the right place!

Contents is looking for an enthusiastic Data Scientist to join our team.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, test and implement ML models;
  • Design and implement machine learning pipelines and models, including Ensemble methods, Recommender System, NLP, and Deep Learning;
  • Manage and implement Recommender System algorithms, such as Non-personalized Recommender, Content-based Recommender, Collaborative Filter, etc.
  • Develop and implement real-time ML models, exposing ML results through API;
  • Design and conduct tests of new projects to analyze and monitor the results of our products and websites;
  • Collaborate with our software engineers and vendors to integrate ML algorithms into our applications;
  • Develop and apply end-to-end NLP/NLG methodologies for content creation.

Join Us If You

  • Have a degree in data science or a STEM field such as statistics, mathematics, physics;
  • Have experience in data science and data analysis, including statistical analysis, A/B testing, and conducting experiments in large-scale environments;
  • Are familiar with ML/NLP applications;
  • Experience with Colab, Jupiter, Spyder, PyCharm;
  • Are experienced in developing NLG algorithms;
  • Have excellent programming skills and understanding of software architectures;
  • Excellent knowledge of Python;
  • Knowledge of NLP models such as BERT and Python libraries such as Tensorflow, PyTorch, Transformers;
  • Have an understanding of the fundamentals of REST APIs;
  • Have an independent spirit and can manage multiple projects simultaneously;
  • Know how to express yourself wisely, clearly, and with just the right touch of charisma.

Why do you apply?

  • Attention to people. For this reason, also this year, we are a Great Place to Work, ranked among the Companies where you work Best in Italy!
  • Young, dynamic, and proactive working environment.
  • Hybrid work. We do everything we can to adapt to flexibility.
  • Fun. Unexpected team building events, Family and friends days, and happy hours with colleagues, to name a few of the initiatives.

Want you a mini-spoiler on Contents?

Contents is revolutionizing the way enterprises manage and deploy digital content, offering a bespoke all-in-one platform for content creation and workflow management.

By bridging the gap between AI platforms, digital properties, and data-driven strategies, we empower our clients to enhance their online presence and drive deeper audience engagement.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and highly value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Data Scientist - Stage Extra Curriculare
HTML:
Aramix è un'azienda italiana innovativa specializzata nella progettazione e implementazione di soluzioni di Intelligenza Artificiale su misura. I nostri clienti appartengono a molteplici settori tra cui vendita al dettaglio, telecomunicazioni, alimenti e bevande, petrolio e gas, finanza, ecc. Li supportiamo con tecniche di analisi dei dati all'avanguardia per raggiungere i loro obiettivi di business.

Aramix fa parte del gruppo Datrix, un Gruppo italiano composto da 5 tech companies specializzate nella progettazione e implementazione di soluzioni B2B di Intelligenza Artificiale sostenibili, per la crescita delle imprese.

Il gruppo Datrix è anche partner tecnologico di oltre 20 università e centri di ricerca internazionali per importanti progetti di ricerca e sviluppo. L’ambiente di lavoro è dinamico, flessibile ma soprattutto giovane: da noi le tue idee, esperienze e volontà di trovare soluzioni creative ed innovative fanno realmente la differenza.

Aramix è alla ricerca di un motivato ed entusiasta Data Scientist, con una laurea STEM, AI e/o ML. Il candidato scelto lavorerà con diverse tipologie di dati come serie temporali, immagini e testo e avrà l'opportunità di contribuire allo sviluppo di soluzioni innovative a problemi industriali reali in contesti chiave dell'Industria 4.0. con un focus di interesse per il mondo tech, digital ed AI.

Le responsabilità della figura saranno:

  • Presentare, discutere, progettare e documentare il proprio lavoro;
  • Condurre analisi esplorative sui dati e presentare le evidenze emerse;
  • Contribuire allo sviluppo di soluzioni di AI;
  • Contribuire alla manutenzione ed aggiornamento di pipeline di continuous integration and deploy;
  • Partecipare a riunioni tecniche e operative.

Requisiti

Requisiti:

  • NECESSARIO AVERE DOMICILIO IN LOMBARDIA

Le competenze essenziali per un inserimento ottimale in azienda sono:

  • Laurea magistrale in ambito scientifico, preferibilmente Matematica, Fisica e Informatica;
  • Buon background tecnico nelle tecniche di machine learning e analisi dei dati;
  • Buona conoscenza in ambito statistico e di machine-learning;
  • Capacità di sviluppare codice Python in maniera autonoma;
  • Buona conoscenza delle librerie Python per il machine learning e l’intelligenza artificiale (pandas, scikit-learn, pytorch, tensorflow, langchain, ecc…);
  • Familiarità con l’utilizzo di database;
  • Inglese fluente parlato e scritto.

Le competenze nice to have invece sono:

  • Conoscenza della pratica di analisi del rischio;
  • Conoscenza del linguaggio SQL (l'esperienza NoSQL è un vantaggio);
  • Esperienza su ambiente Cloud;
  • Conoscenza delle pratiche di sviluppo software;
  • Esperienza pregressa nell'utilizzo dei sistemi operativi Linux;
  • Dottorato di ricerca ed esperienza di ricerca.

Benefit

Per la posizione in stage è previsto un rimborso pari a 700 € per i primi 6 mesi, da rivalutare in caso di rinnovo fino ai 12 mesi.

E’ previsto il PC aziendale per un miglior svolgimento delle attività richieste ed è consentita una modalità di lavoro agile, ovvero l’azienda applica una “100% smart working policy”: sarai tu a scegliere quando lavorare presso i nostri uffici a Milano, compatibilmente alle esigenze formative, e quando a lavorare da casa.

Title: AI Developer - MILANO [DIG]
HTML:
Trasforma le tue aspirazioni professionali in una storia di successo, entra in PwC come AI Developer.

Your Perspectives

Entra a Far Parte Del Nostro Team Digital Innovation - AI Center Of Excellence In Rapida Crescita e Partecipa Allo Sviluppo Di Rivoluzionarie Applicazioni Basate Su Tecnologie Di Intelligenza Artificiale. Avrai L’opportunità Di

  • Sviluppare progetti basati su algoritmi di intelligenza artificiale, sia per ottimizzazioni dei processi interni o per clienti che integrati in innovative soluzioni software;
  • Contribuire attivamente alla crescita della nostra struttura dedicata all'Intelligenza Artificiale, in particolare al Natural Language Understanding e alla Computer Vision;
  • Partecipare al ciclo di vita di un prodotto basato su AI, dall’analisi del business case, al tuning dei modelli, allo sviluppo delle componenti applicative richieste dall’applicazione fino alla realizzazione della User Experience ideale;
  • Muoverti in un contesto organizzato, dove gli aspetti metodologici e di relazione assumono una rilevanza strategica con respiro internazionale e multiculturale;
  • Operare in un contesto organizzato, dove gli aspetti metodologici e di relazione assumono una rilevanza strategica con respiro internazionale e multiculturale;
  • Garantire l’erogazione dei deliverables di progetto concordati con il Project Manager di riferimento e con i committenti, in accordo con i vincoli di budget e quality condivisi;
  • Fornire supporto applicativo a soluzioni basate su moduli di Intelligenza Artificiale, Large Language Models e Computer Vision, sia esistenti che di nuova realizzazione.

Your unique strengths

  • Possiedi una laurea in discipline STEM;
  • Hai esperienza nello sviluppo e addestramento di modelli utilizzando tecniche di Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing e Computer Vision, sia a partire dai framework più utilizzati (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Spark ML, Spark GraphX) che da servizi SaaS (Google Vertex AI, Azure Cognitive Services, OpenAI);
  • Hai esperienza nell'utilizzo di Python per lo sviluppo di soluzioni basate su AI e sei interessato a lavorare con Large Language Models come OpenAI e tecniche di Computer Vision come OCR, YoLo, etc.;
  • Hai basi di Semantic Web e conosci l’architettura dei motori di ricerca evoluti (Elastic Search, Solr, Lucene);
  • Hai utilizzato strutture dati NoSQL (MongoDB o componenti dell'ecosistema Hadoop);
  • Conosci approfonditamente linguaggi di programmazione object oriented come Java/Scala, C++ o Python;
  • Sei capace di mettere in pratica tecniche di "Continuous Learning" al fine di cogliere opportunità da nuove tecnologie senza abbandonarti alla sola attività di ricerca;
  • Possiedi tecniche di ascolto attivo, capacità di sintesi e di problem solving;
  • Ti contraddistingui per intraprendenza e curiosità, spiccato senso di responsabilità professionale;
  • Possiedi una conoscenza avanzata della lingua inglese (parlata e scritta).

Set your expectation higher

PwC ti sorprenderà con un’opportunità di carriera che ti farà sentire al centro della società, dell’innovazione e del cambiamento. Il tuo talento e la tua curiosità avranno tutto lo spazio che meritano e, attraverso l’identificazione delle migliori risorse, contribuirai a garantire la qualità dei servizi che offriamo ai nostri clienti. In questo percorso di crescita sarai accompagnato da colleghi esperti e da una formazione continua e su misura grazie alla quale potrai mettere le tue competenze a disposizione dei clienti interni.

Feel at home

Ci prendiamo cura delle nostre persone, abbracciando le diversità e creando valore per i clienti, le persone e la comunità, nel rispetto dell'ambiente. GIVE YOUR LIFE A DIFFERENT PERSPECTIVE

Title: Data Scientist/Analytics – Fully Remote
Description:
🚀 Be part of a movement to change the way Europe pays

In today’s digital world, payments often still feel outdated: random delays and confusing rules make it harder than it should be to pay and get paid. The European Payments Initiative (EPI) is here to change all that, forever. 

With Wero, our digital wallet, we make sending and receiving money simple, seamless and secure across France, Belgium and Germany, with more countries and omnichannel solutions coming soon. Supported by 14 major banks and the two largest European acquirers, EPI is building a new, proudly European payment system: easy, instant and transparent, all for the greater good.




🔎 What's in it for you

Are you passionate about data and eager to make a significant impact on the largest payment initiatives in Europe? Do you thrive on uncovering insights from complex datasets and translating them into actionable strategies? Are you excited by the prospect of driving innovation and shaping the future of payment solutions across the continent? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!





🐝 About the team

You’ll be part of a Pan-European Data Team that operates in an Agile environment. You’ll work closely — but fully remotely — with data engineers and data analysts from Germany, France, the Netherlands, Poland, and other European locations. Our team has recently built a cutting-edge tech stack using the best tools in the market. We aim to provide end-to-end data services, from data collection to decision support, through a federated data team model.




💥 Your impact

Create metrics and build data pipelines, transforming raw data into valuable insights for critical decision-making
Perform deep-dive analyses to uncover insights and trends within the data using state-of-art data science tools
Present findings and recommendations to senior management and support your stakeholders with data driven decision consultancy
Work closely with cross-functional teams including marketing, product, finance, and operations to support their analytics need
Ensure data accuracy and integrity in all analyses, solutions and reports.
Translate business knowledge to data models for analytics and reporting needs.




💻 Technology stack

Primary: DBT, Databricks, Tableau, AWS Kinesis, Github
Secondary: Terraform, MongoDB, Event-sourcing





🕵🏻‍♀️ To succeed, you should meet at least 70% of these requirements

+6 years of professional experience in data science/analysis, data engineering, and business intelligence
Master’s or PhD degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Quantitative Economics, Engineering, or a related STEM field.
Knowledge of applied machine learning techniques
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages such as SQL, Python, or R
Experience with collaborative CI/CD using GitHub
Excellent data-oriented problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Strong presentation skills and ability to work independently and as part of a team
Fluent in English (CEFR C1 or C2); French, German or Dutch or any additional European languages is a plus
Experience with Tableau or Power BI for dashboard creation and data visualization is a plus
Experience in the payment processing industry is a plus





🪜 If this looks like you, the recruitment steps are:

A first call with one of our recruiters
A Technical interview with our Data Project Lead
An interview with your potential colleagues
A final interview with our Head of Engineering
Hopefully, an offer you can’t refuse





⛔ Turn back if …

You don’t have advanced experience in data science tools and programming languages such as SQL and Python/R.


Otherwise apply!




🫶 Our commitment to equal employment opportunities

EPI offers the same job opportunities to all, without distinction of gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, social status, disability or age. EPI promotes the development of an inclusive work environment that mirrors the diversity of the clients our product is serving.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
RAND is a not-for-profit research institute with over 30 years of experience in conducting policy research for governments, international organisations, research councils, charitable foundations, and other organisations. We believe that good research helps shape sound answers to pressing societal challenges, ultimately making communities safer and more secure, healthier and more prosperous in the future. RAND Europe has offices in Cambridge, Brussels and Rotterdam and employs approximately 170 staff.

The research groups in RAND Europe boast a diverse portfolio, addressing key public policy challenges such as education and child welfare, health and wellbeing, geopolitical competition and national security, environment and climate change, technological innovation and disruption, among many others. Our team, comprising individuals from various nationalities and professional backgrounds, is dedicated to advancing innovative approaches to address pressing societal issues.

We are now seeking a Data Scientist to enhance our cross-research group data science capabilities. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in delivering tools to support our research which shaping public policy research, influencing high-level government decision-making in the UK, the European Union, and globally. This role offers the chance to engage in intellectually stimulating work within a dynamic and diverse team, tackling a broad spectrum of topics, and employing cutting-edge methods, including AI/ML.

We welcome applications from a range of experience levels, from those slightly below to those exceeding our criteria.

Responsibilities


Spearhead project delivery and research tool development within the research group portfolios, emphasising the integration of data-driven evidence
Coordinate complex projects, mentor a team of talented data scientists and researchers, and drive the impact of our work through strategic communication and outreach
Utilise a broad spectrum of data science skills and remain committed to continuous learning and methodological innovation
Lead and support impactful R&D, mentor staff, and expand our research scope
Drive business development, manage proposals, and cultivate funding relationships
Collaborate with the leadership teams to shape research strategy and contribute to RAND Europe's broader objectives



Requirements

Essential


Expertise in data science and quantitative methods (e.g., statistical analysis, machine learning, causal inference, simulation modelling, network analysis, econometrics, natural language processing, use of large language models etc.)
Strong project management skills, including budgeting and team leadership
Exceptional analytical, writing, and presentation abilities, with a knack for conveying complex concepts to diverse audiences
A track record of collaborative research and team motivation, with a focus on skills and career development
Higher Degree in a quantitative research discipline
Ability to explain quantitative research to non-specialists and integrate it into mixed-methods projects including non-technical team members
Proven project delivery within time and budget constraints
Interest in public policy areas and collaborative research delivery



Desirable


Additional technical skills (e.g., general coding skills, data mining, dashboard and tool development, data management, data visualisation etc.)
Experience applying data science methods and tools to support policy research and/or social sciences research
Eligibility for UK Security Clearance (SC) or Developed Vetting (DV)



Personal Qualities:


Strategic and analytical thinker with a practical perspective
Networking and presentation skills to foster relationships and secure funding
Team-oriented with a commitment to rigorous research and public service
Eagerness to learn, contribute to team development, and embrace new challenges


This role is based in our Cambridge office however we offer a hybrid working model asking staff to attend the office a minimum of once a week. There is occasional travel, primarily to London and Brussels.

(We can also consider offering this role based out of our Brussels or Netherlands office.)

Benefits

Please see our careers page for associate benefits for each location

How To Apply

If you believe you are suited to the above role, please submit an application comprising of a CV and covering letter. Closing date for applications is Sunday 10th November 2024

If you have not been contacted within 30 days of application deadline, please assume your application has not been successful.

The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in delivering tools to support our research which shaping public policy research, influencing high-level government decision-making in the UK, the European Union, and globally. This role offers the chance to engage in intellectually stimulating work within a dynamic and diverse team, tackling a broad spectrum of topics, and employing cutting-edge methods, including AI/ML.

We welcome applications from a range of experience levels, from those slightly below to those exceeding our criteria.

Responsibilities

  • Spearhead project delivery and research tool development within the research group portfolios, emphasising the integration of data-driven evidence
  • Coordinate complex projects, mentor a team of talented data scientists and researchers, and drive the impact of our work through strategic communication and outreach
  • Utilise a broad spectrum of data science skills and remain committed to continuous learning and methodological innovation
  • Lead and support impactful R&D, mentor staff, and expand our research scope
  • Drive business development, manage proposals, and cultivate funding relationships
  • Collaborate with the leadership teams to shape research strategy and contribute to RAND Europe's broader objectives


Requirements

Essential

  • Expertise in data science and quantitative methods (e.g., statistical analysis, machine learning, causal inference, simulation modelling, network analysis, econometrics, natural language processing, use of large language models etc.)
  • Strong project management skills, including budgeting and team leadership
  • Exceptional analytical, writing, and presentation abilities, with a knack for conveying complex concepts to diverse audiences
  • A track record of collaborative research and team motivation, with a focus on skills and career development
  • Higher Degree in a quantitative research discipline
  • Ability to explain quantitative research to non-specialists and integrate it into mixed-methods projects including non-technical team members
  • Proven project delivery within time and budget constraints
  • Interest in public policy areas and collaborative research delivery


Desirable

  • Additional technical skills (e.g., general coding skills, data mining, dashboard and tool development, data management, data visualisation etc.)
  • Experience applying data science methods and tools to support policy research and/or social sciences research
  • Eligibility for UK Security Clearance (SC) or Developed Vetting (DV)


Personal Qualities:

  • Strategic and analytical thinker with a practical perspective
  • Networking and presentation skills to foster relationships and secure funding
  • Team-oriented with a commitment to rigorous research and public service
  • Eagerness to learn, contribute to team development, and embrace new challenges

This role is based in our Cambridge office however we offer a hybrid working model asking staff to attend the office a minimum of once a week. There is occasional travel, primarily to London and Brussels.

(We can also consider offering this role based out of our Brussels or Netherlands office.)

Benefits

Please see our careers page for associate benefits for each location

How To Apply

If you believe you are suited to the above role, please submit an application comprising of a CV and covering letter. Closing date for applications is Sunday 10th November 2024

If you have not been contacted within 30 days of application deadline, please assume your application has not been successful.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
I am currently searching for a senior freelance Data Scientist to join a valued client of mine in Brussels.




In your day to day, you will apply advanced graph theory, learning, and mining techniques to extract insights, optimize application lifecycle management, and support cloud migration efforts. This role offers the chance to work on cutting-edge technologies and contribute to impactful digital transformation projects.




Key Responsibilities:




Modernize Application Lifecycle Management: Develop strategies for optimizing application lifecycle management and migration processes, leveraging advanced graph learning techniques.




Advanced Methodologies: Apply cutting-edge graph theory, graph mining, and machine learning methods to exploit the knowledge graph, contributing to both operational efficiency and strategic decision-making.




Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, developers, and business stakeholders, to ensure successful integration of data science methodologies into the organization's digital transformation efforts.




Innovation: Identify opportunities for improvement, propose new solutions, and stay ahead of industry trends in digital twins, AI, and graph learning.







Required Technical Experience:




AI & Machine Learning: Expertise in R, Python, and graph learning technologies.




Graph-Based Approaches: Experience with knowledge graphs, graph mining, and related technologies.




Programming & Tools: Proficiency in Python, Spark, SQL, and familiarity with tools like GitLab, Jupyter, Kubernetes, Docker, Jenkins, and Nexus.




Databases: Strong working knowledge of Neo4j and SQL databases.




Analytical Skills: Exceptional ability to synthesize complex data, think critically, and propose data-driven solutions.




Education: A Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field is required. A PhD is a plus.




Languages: English and Dutch OR French




The Offer:

Long-term freelance contract
Hybrid working in Brussels
Up to €650 per day (DOE)
Start date ASAP




If you are interested in this position, please apply now!

Title: Data Scientists in Residence
Description:
Are you passionate about harnessing the power of data to drive innovation? Do you thrive in dynamic, collaborative environments? Join Apziva, a rapidly growing platform that's redefining the future of work.




About Apziva:

Apziva is a global company working with professionals from over 65+ countries. Apziva’s mission is to solve the world’s experience gap and unlock human potential. Apziva helps talented professionals to gain hands-on practical industry experience in Machine Learning and Data Science by working on real-world industry projects. Apziva’s unique platform helps companies to solve challenging Machine Learning problems and help them hire the best Data Science candidates with proven work experience vetted through our unique platform.




Position Overview:

As a Data Scientist in Residence you will be joining our 6-month Residency in which you'll dive deep into several industry projects, collaborating with a team of professionals and working on challenging projects coming from Apziva’s industry partners across different industries including Finance, Logistics, Education, Hardware, Retail, and Human Resources. This is a unique opportunity to work on industry projects, get mentored by industry experts, sharpen your skills, and make meaningful contributions to solve real-world challenges our partners face.




About the Opportunity:

Hands-on industry experience in a dynamic and supportive environment.

Exposure to cutting-edge tools and technologies in data science and analytics.

Opportunity to contribute to real-world projects and build up your professional portfolio.

Deep dive into the full project life cycle, from model development to deployment.

Gain insights into diverse industries and work on challenging problems spanning Deep Learning, Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing, Time Series Analysis, and Recommender Systems.

Collaborate with a team of experts and mentors to drive innovation and deliver impactful solutions.




Requirements:

BA or BS degree, or equivalent experience in Mathematics, Statistics, Business Analytics, Economics, Physics, Engineering, or related fields.

Knowledge of Python, SQL, pandas, matplotlib, Scikit-Learn.

Strong understanding of statistical concepts and machine learning algorithms.

Exceptional problem-solving skills and keen attention to detail.

Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.

Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.




What We Offer:

The Residency will consist of approximately 6 months during which you will have mentoring sessions alongside project work. You will explore different industries and learn about the ongoing data initiatives in industry-leading companies. You will also work with industry expert mentors to build reliable machine learning solutions to solve different challenges that our partners face. At the end of the Residency, successful participants will get referred to our hiring partners.




What to Expect Next:

You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online application.

Our platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic qualifications, skills, and finally an interview to finalize the application process.

Title: Data Scientist - LLM
Description:
Python Data Scientist/Analyst

Experience: 4 - 20 Years

Location: - Anywhere in the World - Permanent Remote

Contract Duration: 6-12 months

Work Hours: 5 hours overlap with PST time zone

Standard work hours are 8 AM PST - 4 PM PST.

Must-Have


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
4+ years of experience working with Python programming.
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills.


Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Data Scientists & Analysts proficient in Python to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with companies in the US looking to develop cutting-edge commercial and research AI solutions.

Job Responsibilities


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues, but also use your business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Communicate clearly with researchers and help the organization in realizing its objectives
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks, or other suitable mediums
Fix bugs in the code and create thorough documentation
Utilize extensive data analysis skills to develop and respond to important business queries using available datasets (such as those from Kaggle, the UN, the US government, etc.)
Effectively communicate with the researchers to comprehend the needs and provide the results


Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
4+ years of experience working with Python programming
Strong data analytic abilities and business sense are required to draw the appropriate conclusions from the dataset, respond to those conclusions, and clearly convey the key findings
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Excellent communication abilities to work with stakeholders and researchers successfully
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Role Description:

Are you a passionate machine learning engineer with expertise in generative AI? Join our Machine Learning Enablers team at our client in Brussels . You will leverage your expertise in architectures such as retrieval-augmented generation and agent-based systems to develop and enhance reusable AI components, enabling our data scientists to create impactful and scalable solutions.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with data scientists and engineers from our Cloud and DevSecOps teams to implement best practices and ensure technical excellence across multiple projects. Utilizing open-source frameworks like LangChain and Azure-based tools, including the Azure AI Services suite, you will maintain and expand our repository of AI assets. Your innovative mindset will help identify and develop state-of-the-art solutions that deliver business value, while your commitment to staying current with AI advancements will ensure our team remains at the forefront of technology.

As a member of the Machine Learning Enablers team, you will actively research and develop agent-based AI use cases, focusing on multi-agent systems. Your work will support the day-to-day needs of our data scientists through the practical maintenance and enhancement of AI assets, while also driving innovation in our AI initiatives.




Responsibilities:

Develop and Maintain our Generative AI Repository

• Manage and expand our repository of reusable Generative AI components on Azure DevOps, ensuring it’s robust, up-to-date, and user-friendly, and implements MLOps standards.

• Collaborate with data scientists to identify new components to build, provide technical support, and promote best practices in using the repository.

Develop and Implement Agent-Based AI Solutions

• Research and experiment with multi-agent systems and emerging frameworks to address real-world use cases in client's context.

• Develop proof-of-concept projects to validate innovative multi-agent AI applications.

• Design and create reusable components that enable data scientists to integrate agent-based approaches into their projects.

Collaborate and Drive Technical Excellence

• Implement and promote machine learning best practices (e.g., MLFlow), ensuring high-quality standards across the team.

• Collaborate with Cloud and DevSecOps engineers to ensure we deliver high-quality, scalable, and maintainable AI solutions, contributing to setting technical and architectural standards.

• Stay current with the latest trends, models, and frameworks, and communicate them to the team.




Education

•Master’s degree in Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative field.

• A Ph.D. is a plus, especially with research in Generative AI or agent-based systems.







Professional Experience

• Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience in a business environment.

• Proven experience working with generative AI models and LLMs in real-world projects.

• Demonstrated ability to develop proof-of-concept projects, and transition innovative solutions to production-ready components.

• Strong collaboration and communication skills, with experience working alongside a diverse team of technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Technical Skills

• Strong coding skills in Python, with proficiency in software development best practices, including version control (e.g., Git) and DevOps (e.g., CI/CD pipelines).

• Hands-on experience implementing MLOps best practices (e.g., experiment tracking with MLFlow).

• Experience with Microsoft Azure and Azure AI Services.

• Experience with LangChain and other Generative AI frameworks.

• Ability to drive innovation by experimenting with new techniques and frameworks to solve real-world problems.

• Familiarity with Retrieval-Augmented Generation architectures and improvement techniques.

• Strong communication skills for providing technical support, mentorship, and clear guidance to team members.

• Strong collaboration skills and ability to manage tasks independently.

• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail.




Nice to Have

• Experience contributing to the development of reusable AI components or libraries, contributions to open-source AI projects.

• Experience with multi-agent systems and related frameworks (e.g. LangGraph, CrewAI, AutoGen).

• Familiarity with monitoring and evaluation tools for generative AI applications.




Languages

Fluent in English and preferably also French and/or Dutch.

Show more

  • Phases I-IV
  • Data Visualization, Risk Based Monitoring, QTL, CtQ, QC
  • Competitive Salary
  • Annual Bonus
  • Start Date: ASAP


If you are interested in the role, please apply or email me with your CV to the email be below.


tom@warmanobrien.com

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Machine Learning Engineer with extensive experience in running and scaling models on public cloud platforms. The successful candidate will join our team to optimize, implement, and maintain our organization’s cloud-based systems.


Responsibilities:**
Design, develop, and deploy modular models on cloud-based systems.
Develop and maintain cloud solutions in accordance with best practices.
Ensure efficient functioning of data storage and processing functions, adhering to company security policies and best practices in cloud security.
Identify, analyze, and resolve infrastructure vulnerabilities and application deployment issues.
Regularly review existing models and systems, making recommendations for improvements.
Collaborate with engineering and development teams to evaluate and identify optimal cloud solutions.
Modify and improve existing systems.
Educate teams on the implementation of new cloud technologies and initiatives.
Technical Skills:**
Proven work experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or in a similar role.
Preferred: GCP certifications.
Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Relevant training and/or certifications as a Google Cloud Engineer.
Proficiency in Google Compute Engine, including creating, managing, and scaling virtual machines (VMs) to meet diverse workload requirements.
Expertise in designing solution architecture on Google Cloud Platform (GCP), aligning with project-specific needs and objectives.
Strong grasp of programming languages such as Python, Java, Go, and Node.js.
Expertise in programming frameworks and libraries specific to GCP, such as Google Cloud SDK, Cloud Client Libraries, and Cloud APIs.
Understanding of serverless computing, containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes), and event-driven architectures for developing scalable and efficient applications on GCP.
Knowledge of containers and infrastructure automation tools.
Proficiency in tools including Ansible, Docker, Windows PowerShell, and Linux/Unix.
Expertise in Google Cloud Storage.
Familiarity with other GCP services like BigQuery, Cloud Pub/Sub, and Cloud Functions.
Software Security Skills:**
Expertise in securing applications and data on Google Cloud, including:
Configuring Identity and Access Management (IAM) to control resource access.
Implementing network security measures such as firewall rules and encryption.
Monitoring and logging security events using tools like Stackdriver Logging.
Ensuring data encryption at rest and in transit.
Securing containers and Kubernetes clusters.
Complying with security standards and regulations.
Developing incident response plans.
Automating security checks and vulnerability scanning.
Following secure development practices.


These skills are crucial for maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of software systems deployed on Google Cloud and protecting against potential threats and vulnerabilities.


Coding and Scripting Skills**
Proficiency in programming languages like Python, Java, or Go to build and customize applications on the Google Cloud Platform.
Knowledge of infrastructure-as-code (IaC) tools such as Terraform and/or Google Cloud Deployment Manager enables defining and managing infrastructure resources using code. Automation is key, utilizing scripting languages and tools like Cloud SDK or Cloud APIs to automate tasks, deployments, and resource management.
Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes enables efficient deployment and management of applications. Cloud API integration and utilization of monitoring and logging tools like Stackdriver aid in application monitoring, troubleshooting, and enhancing overall performance. These skills empower developers to optimize and harness the capabilities of Google Cloud for building scalable and reliable cloud solutions.
Testing Skills**


The primary objective of any GCP Engineer is to expedite the software delivery process for clients, ensuring swift and efficient deployment.

To Excel GCP Skills, It Is Imperative To Possess


Strong testing skills and a comprehensive understanding of the testing process. Testing plays a critical role in driving automation and ensuring successful outcomes in the role.
Additionally, once the appropriate tests are established, a sense of assurance prevails, knowing that each component functions as intended. Tests can be conducted at various stages, from development to deployment, to ensure seamless integration of new features throughout the entire system.
Finally, emphasizing quality is paramount in the realm of applications and software. As a result, one should continuously prioritize and conduct rigorous testing to deliver high-quality work.


**Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)**


Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) in Google Cloud refers to a set of practices and tools that enable developers to automate the process of building, testing, and deploying applications. CI involves automatically integrating code changes into a shared repository and running tests to ensure code quality. CD takes it further by automating the deployment of tested code to production environments. In Google Cloud, CI/CD pipelines can be set up using tools like Cloud Build, Cloud Source Repositories, and Cloud Deployment Manager. These pipelines help streamline development workflows, increase collaboration, and ensure rapid and reliable application delivery, allowing teams to deliver software updates more frequently and with reduced manual effort.
Azure DevOps and Azure Pipelines


An Ideal Candidate Should Also Demonstrate The Following Behaviours


Self-learning abilities
Radiates energy & enthusiasm for his field, and can instil the same passion in others
Naturally curious & always a step ahead
Critical thinker, challenging others in a constructive way, continuously looking for improvements
Can combine big-picture thinking, with zooming in on details.


Show more

Title: AI/ML/NLP Engineer
HTML:
Requirements:


  • Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field, combined with minimum 17 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Substantial leadership experience in overseeing and technically leading largescale AI transformation projects along with strong communication and soft skills;
  • Proven experience in designing, implementing, optimizing and deploying advanced machine learning models and latest AI systems;
  • Strong experience with large language models (LLMs) and natural language processing (NLP) techniques;
  • Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS;
  • Solid experience in Microsoft Azure Analytics (e.g. Microsoft Fabric) and related AI services (e.g., AI Studio, Azure ML, and AI Search);
  • Experience with data processing and ETL tools;
  • Deep understanding of machine learning frameworks and libraries;
  • Familiarity with MLOps practices and tools;
  • PhD is considered an asset;
  • Excellent command of the English language.

Title: ML Engineer - Gen AI
Description:
Are you a passionate Machine Learning Engineer with expertise in generative AI?




In this role, you will collaborate closely with data scientists and engineers from our Cloud and DevSecOps teams to implement best practices and ensure technical excellence across multiple projects. Utilizing open-source frameworks like LangChain and Azure-based tools, including the Azure AI Services suite, you will maintain and expand our repository of AI assets. Your innovative mindset will help identify and develop state-of-the-art solutions that deliver business value, while your commitment to staying current with AI advancements will ensure our team remains at the forefront of technology.




As a member of the Machine Learning Enablers team, you will actively research and develop agent-based AI use cases, focusing on multi-agent systems. Your work will support the day-to-day needs of our data scientists through the practical maintenance and enhancement of AI assets, while also driving innovation in our AI initiatives.




Responsibilities:




Develop and Maintain our Generative AI Repository.

Manage and expand our repository of reusable Generative AI components on Azure DevOps, ensuring it’s robust, up-to-date, and user-friendly, and implements MLOps standadrs.
Collaborate with data scientists to identify new components to build, provide technical support, and promote best practices in using the repository.

Develop and Implement Agent-Based AI Solutions.

Research and experiment with multi-agent systems and emerging frameworks to address real-world use cases in Proximus’ context.
Develop proof-of-concept projects to validate innovative multi-agent AI applications.
Design and create reusable components that enable data scientists to integrate agent-based approaches into their projects.

Collaborate and Drive Technical Excellence.

Implement and promote machine learning best practices (e.g., MLFlow), ensuring high-quality standards across the team.
Stay current with the latest trends, models, and frameworks, and communicate them to the team.




Your Profile:

Master’s degree in Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative field.
A Ph.D. is a plus, especially with research in Generative AI or agent-based systems.
Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience in a business environment.
Proven experience working with generative AI models and LLMs in real-world projects.
Demonstrated ability to develop proof-of-concept projects, and transition innovative solutions to production-ready components.
Strong collaboration and communication skills, with experience working alongside a diverse team of technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Technical Skills:

Strong coding skills in Python, with proficiency in software development best practices, including version control (e.g., Git) and DevOps (e.g., CI/CD pipelines).
Hands-on experience implementing MLOps best practices (e.g., experiment tracking with MLFlow).
Experience with Microsoft Azure and Azure AI Services.
Experience with LangChain and other Generative AI frameworks.
Ability to drive innovation by experimenting with new techniques and frameworks to solve real-world problems.
Familiarity with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) architectures and improvement techniques.
Strong communication skills for providing technical support, mentorship, and clear guidance to team members.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to manage tasks independently.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail.
Experience contributing to the development of reusable AI components or libraries, contributions to open-source AI projects is an asset.
Experience with multi-agent systems and related frameworks (e.g. LangGraph, CrewAI, AutoGen).
Familiarity with monitoring and evaluation tools for generative AI applications.
Fluent in English and preferably also French and/or Dutch.
Show more

Title: YPP, Data Science & Innovation
HTML:
The Young Professionals Programme


Through times of crisis and peace, NATO has safeguarded our freedom and security for 75 years and counting. Threats evolve every day and NATO is continuing to adapt to keep us safe. Together we will make sure our Alliance remains ready today to face the challenges of tomorrow.


We are launching an accelerator for your international career – the second cycle of our Young Professionals Programme (YPP). Through this global three-year programme, you will experience the frontline of a political and military alliance and start a journey of personal and professional development in a diverse and inclusive work environment. Together, we will enable NATO to:

  • Address existing and emerging global challenges with security implications;
  • Facilitate political consultation and dialogue between nations;
  • Leverage innovation, science and technology to support peace and security;
  • Stay ahead in cutting-edge domains such as cyber defence and aerospace;
  • Support multiple operations on land, at sea and in the air around the world;
  • Contribute to the global effort to combat terrorism, piracy and human trafficking; and,
  • Run crisis-management exercises that mobilize thousands of people and items of equipment.


Do you want to make a difference and help protect close to one billion people across 32 NATO member states, including your own? If you are ready to take on this challenge, and are a national of a NATO member state, hold a Master’s degree and have at least one year of work experience, then apply for the YPP.


With you, we are stronger.

#WeAreNATO


Your role


During the three years of the programme, you will be assigned to three different NATO bodies:


Year 1 - NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCIA) - (The Hague, The Netherlands)

Year 2 - Allied Command Transformation (ACT) - (Norfolk, United States of America)

Year 3 - NATO International Military Staff (IMS) – NATO HQ – NATO Standardization Office (NSO) - (Brussels, Belgium)


For more information, please see the path narrative here. You can also find more information about the NATO bodies here & the NATO Young Professionals Programme here.


This is an opportunity for you to apply your knowledge and skills in the broader area of Data Science & Innovation. As you gain experience, you will be given increasing responsibilities, such as:

  • Developing, implementing and promoting the use of data science and Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies in support of NATO policy development and NATO’s digital transformation;
  • Working on data science projects that contribute to better decision-making and multi-domain military operations;
  • Researching and employing research and analysis techniques (e.g. modelling, simulation, war gaming, Analyses of Alternatives);
  • Supporting the development of joint analysis of operations, training, exercises and experiments, based on technical requirements defined within the NATO enterprise;
  • Constantly scouting for new ideas, adoption of innovation and technological developments of relevance to the Alliance;
  • Coordinating and collaborating with stakeholders across NATO, Allies, partners and Industry in support of achieving allied objectives;
  • Informing the Strategic Level about military implications of Technological Innovation; and,
  • Researching new trends within the areas of responsibilities of Data Science & Innovation.


Who we are looking for


The changing pace of the world demands that NATO and its people remain flexible, eager to learn and able to work effectively with a variety of stakeholders from diverse backgrounds. For a YPP position, we are looking for candidates with at least 1 year of professional experience.


For the YPP Data Science & Innovation path, we are generally interested in the following educational backgrounds:

  • A Masters’ degree in the field of STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics);
  • Any other degree that you believe can be useful to the area of Data Science & Innovation – let us know how your knowledge and skills can be applied!


Any of the following experience or skills would be considered as an asset:

  • Academic knowledge or professional experience in the fields of Data Science, Artificial Intelligence (AI), and Operational Research & Analysis;
  • Understanding of AI and data science, including but not limited to technology and policy matters, particularly as applicable to security and defence;
  • Experience with writing policy reports on technology topics, preferably in the areas of AI and data;
  • Genuine interest in Technology Innovation topics in international and multi-disciplinary contexts;
  • Experience with at least one data analysis tool (such as Power BI, Matlab, KNIME, Python, VBA) preferably in the context of a project;
  • Experience with Natural Language Processing, machine learning engineering, or computer vision;
  • Knowledge of NATO, its agenda, policies, military posture, and/or partnerships;
  • Prior professional experience or internship with other International Organizations, National Administration, research or tech industry;
  • Any additional training/certification(s) related to Data Science & Innovation and project or program management certification;
  • A curious & innovative mindset;
  • Strong analytical & drafting skills;
  • Proactivity, can-do attitude and a willingness to learn and share information; and,
  • Teamwork, excellent communication, facilitation and interpersonal skills.


What we offer


NATO will offer the Young Professionals:

  • An experience of a lifetime at the forefront of an international organization where you’ll have the opportunity to develop your skills and expand your professional network;
  • A diverse and stimulating work and personal experience where you will be assigned to three different NATO bodies around the globe, one each year; and,
  • A competitive salary and other benefits, including excellent health insurance and a generous annual leave package of 30 days.


Are you interested in being part of NATO and the YPP? Apply by 27 October 2024 [23:59 – CET Brussels]


RECRUITMENT PROCESS


Please note that we can only accept applications from nationals of NATO member countries. Applications must be submitted using e-recruitment system, as applicable:

  • For NATO civilian staff members only: please apply via the internal recruitment portal (link);
  • For all other applications: www.nato.int/recruitment


Please note that at the time of the interviews, candidates will be asked to provide evidence of their education and professional experience as relevant for this vacancy.

Appointment will be subject to receipt of a security clearance (provided by the national Authorities of the selected candidate) and approval of the candidate’s medical file by the NATO Medical Adviser.


More information about the recruitment process and conditions of employment, can be found at our website (http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/recruit-hq-e.htm)

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Purpose of position


Data sits at the heart of the company. This role is to ensure that Awin is able to leverage the data it has access to across the group and build out reporting to ensure we are able to make better commercial decisions and provide best-in-class campaign management to support client facing departments.
As a Data Scientist, your responsibility is to leverage advance statistical methods and machine learning algorithms to analyze complex dataset and extract actionable insights that drive business decision
You will develop, test, and deploy predictive models, ensuring scalability and optimal performance, while collaborating closely with Data Engineers to maintain data quality and consistency.
Within the role, you will be creating and optimizing features, building reusable data pipelines, and clearly documenting processes and methodologies. Additionally, you will also refine existing models based on new data and advancements, mentor junior team members, and promote a collaborative, data-driven culture.


Key Tasks & Accountabilities


Analyze and interpret complex datasets using statistical methods and machine learning algorithms to extract actionable insights.
Develop, test, and deploy predictive and classification models, optimizing them for performance and scalability.
Collaborate with Data Engineers to clean, preprocess, and structure data, ensuring quality and consistency throughout the workflow.
Create and optimize features for models, building reusable pipelines with engineers and leveraging domain knowledge.
Document processes and methodologies clearly, and present results and insights in an actionable way to stakeholders.
Continuously refine models based on new data and advancements, while mentoring junior team members and fostering collaboration.


Education & Experience


Bachelor's degree or higher in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, or Data Engineering, with a focus on Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, or Machine Learning is preferred.
4+ years of experience working as a Data Scientist, AI/ML Engineer, or Data Engineer, with proficiency in Python, R, or similar programming languages.
Strong knowledge of AI/ML frameworks and libraries like Databricks MLOps, Microsoft Azure ML Studio, or Amazon SageMaker, MLlib, MLOps, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Matplotlib, and Spark.
Excellent understanding of AWS or Azure data engineering pipelines, particularly AWS Glue, AWS Lambda, Azure Data Factory, Databricks, and Python (NumPy, Pandas).
Solid knowledge of database and dimensional modeling technologies.
Familiarity with Scrum and Agile practices.
Proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills.


Skills & Core Competences


Strong ability to analyze large datasets, identify patterns, and generate insights using statistical methods.
Experience in developing, testing, and deploying machine learning models like classification and predictive models, with expertise in algorithms such as decision trees and regression.
Proficient in data cleaning, preprocessing, and feature engineering to ensure quality and consistency in models.
Skilled in Python, R, SQL, and familiar with libraries such as NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and PySpark.
Collaborative approach to working with Data Engineers and teams to integrate and optimize machine learning models for performance and scalability.
Capable of documenting methodologies and processes clearly, and continuously adapting models based on the latest advancements.
Experience mentoring junior data scientists and fostering knowledge sharing across the team.
Strong customer focus and service attitude
A team player and ability to work on own self
Proactive approach to tasks & challenges


Our Offer


Flexi-Week and Work-Life Balance: We prioritise your mental health and wellbeing, offering you a flexible four-day Flexi-Week at full pay and with no reduction to your annual holiday allowance. We also offer a variety of different paid special leaves.
Remote Working Allowance: You will receive a monthly allowance to cover part of your running costs. In addition, we will support you in setting up your remote workspace appropriately.
Flexi-Office: We offer an international culture and flexibility through our Flexi-Office and hybrid/remote work possibilities to work across Awin regions
Meal Vouchers: You will be supported with a certain net sum to spend it on a variety of lunches.
Health & Wellbeing: The insurance covers several types of health, vision and / or dental treatments for you and for up to one additional family member.
Remote Working Furniture Package: After 3 months of employment, you will be eligible for a furniture package, which should enable you to set up a proper workplace at your remote working location
Appreciation: Thank and reward colleagues by sending them a voucher through our peer-to-peer program.


Established in 2000, Awin is proud of our dynamic, social and inclusive culture.

Like all businesses, we’ve had to adapt and nurture our culture in a virtual environment. Our virtual ‘Life @ Awin’ hub brings our colleagues from across the globe together for various social activities.

Diversity & Inclusion are paramount to us, and we proudly pursue and hire diverse team members. We champion uniqueness and authenticity; this is who we are at our core. Our network of affiliate partnerships are diverse and transparent, as are the employees powering our vision to build the world’s leading open partner ecosystem. We welcome all backgrounds, identities, and experiences. If you need support at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Apply now to begin the next stage of your career at a progressive company that supports both your professional and personal development.

  • Flexi-Week and Work-Life Balance: We prioritise your mental health and wellbeing, offering you a flexible four-day Flexi-Week at full pay and with no reduction to your annual holiday allowance. We also offer a variety of different paid special leaves.
  • Remote Working Allowance: You will receive a monthly allowance to cover part of your running costs. In addition, we will support you in setting up your remote workspace appropriately.
  • Flexi-Office: We offer an international culture and flexibility through our Flexi-Office and hybrid/remote work possibilities to work across Awin regions
  • Meal Vouchers: You will be supported with a certain net sum to spend it on a variety of lunches.
  • Health & Wellbeing: The insurance covers several types of health, vision and / or dental treatments for you and for up to one additional family member.
  • Remote Working Furniture Package: After 3 months of employment, you will be eligible for a furniture package, which should enable you to set up a proper workplace at your remote working location
  • Appreciation: Thank and reward colleagues by sending them a voucher through our peer-to-peer program.

Established in 2000, Awin is proud of our dynamic, social and inclusive culture.

Like all businesses, we’ve had to adapt and nurture our culture in a virtual environment. Our virtual ‘Life @ Awin’ hub brings our colleagues from across the globe together for various social activities.

Diversity & Inclusion are paramount to us, and we proudly pursue and hire diverse team members. We champion uniqueness and authenticity; this is who we are at our core. Our network of affiliate partnerships are diverse and transparent, as are the employees powering our vision to build the world’s leading open partner ecosystem. We welcome all backgrounds, identities, and experiences. If you need support at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Apply now to begin the next stage of your career at a progressive company that supports both your professional and personal development.

Title: AI Data Scientist
Description:
AI Data Scientist AI/ML (Previous pharmaceuticals experience)

Fully remote - Europe based

1 Year contract




We are seeking an experienced AI Data Scientist with a strong background in deep learning and a passion for hands-on coding and modelling. In this role, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and deploy models that solve complex business challenges.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and deploy deep learning models to tackle business problems.
Perform hands-on coding in Python, R, or similar programming languages to build scalable AI solutions.
Research and implement the latest advancements in AI and deep learning techniques.
Collaborate with data engineers and product teams to integrate models into production systems.
Continuously optimise and refine models for performance, scalability, and accuracy.
Communicate results and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.




Requirements:

4-5 years of experience in data science, with a focus on deep learning and AI.
Proficiency in Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or other deep learning frameworks.
Strong understanding of neural networks, CNNs, RNNs, and other deep learning architectures.
Experience with large datasets and deep learning model training at scale.
Incredibly hands-on in coding, data wrangling, and model development.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering practical AI solutions.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) for AI model deployment is a plus.
Must have a PHD

Title: Sr Data Scientist - LLM
Description:
Python Data Scientist/Analyst

Experience: 4 - 20 Years

Location: - Anywhere in the World - Permanent Remote

Contract Duration: 6-12 months

Work Hours: 5 hours overlap with PST time zone

Standard work hours are 8 AM PST - 4 PM PST.

Must-Have


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
4+ years of experience working with Python programming.
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills.


Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Data Scientists & Analysts proficient in Python to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with companies in the US looking to develop cutting-edge commercial and research AI solutions.

Job Responsibilities


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues, but also use your business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Communicate clearly with researchers and help the organization in realizing its objectives
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks, or other suitable mediums
Fix bugs in the code and create thorough documentation
Utilize extensive data analysis skills to develop and respond to important business queries using available datasets (such as those from Kaggle, the UN, the US government, etc.)
Effectively communicate with the researchers to comprehend the needs and provide the results


Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
4+ years of experience working with Python programming
Strong data analytic abilities and business sense are required to draw the appropriate conclusions from the dataset, respond to those conclusions, and clearly convey the key findings
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Excellent communication abilities to work with stakeholders and researchers successfully
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills

Title: Data Science Strategist
Description:
We are currently seeking a motivated Data Science strategist to help our customers further develop their AI capabilities. The ideal candidate has a strong academic background in data science, engineering, or related fields, and possesses extensive experience in leading innovation projects. We are looking for someone who enjoys building a new business together and thinks along with the needs of our customers.




Responsibilities:

Develop and implement strategic initiatives to meet the organization’s AI and data needs, including utilizing Microsoft Fabric.
Collaborate with diverse stakeholders to drive quality improvement and innovation within the organization.




Requirements:

Extensive knowledge and experience with both data science and AI technologies, including programming languages such as Python or R.
Familiarity with Microsoft Fabric, Azure DevOps, and Data Build Tool (DBT) for data management and analytics
Strong experience in building, optimizing, and deploying LLMs.
Experience with coordinating technical teams and utilizing project management tools.
Excellent analytical, strategic, and problem-solving skills.




Strengths:

Accountability for team development and growth.
Ability to think strategically about decision-making and implementation of innovations based on data analysis and Microsoft technologies.
Strong technical background and a commitment to continuous improvement in a modern technological environment.




If you are a passionate professional looking to advance in a dynamic environment and have a proven track record in guiding and innovating at a strategic level in data science, we invite you to apply.
